content:
Art. 4.163. 
Acceptance by a minor 
A gift made to an unemancipated minor must be accepted by his or her guardian, in accordance with article 410, ¤ 1, of the former Civil Code.
An emancipated minor may accept with the assistance of his or her curator.
However, the father and mother of the emancipated or unemancipated minor, or other ascendants, even during the lifetime of the father and mother, even though they are neither guardians nor curators of the minor, may accept on his or her behalf.
